title: AB 1685
content: The people of California enact the following. Section 43016 of the Health and Safety Code is amended. Section 43016 of the Health and Safety Code imposes civil penalties for violations of emission control laws, with a maximum penalty of $37,500 per violation. Violations related to portable fuel containers or small off-road engines may incur a penalty of up to $500 per unit. Manufacturers or distributors may be required to pay the penalty and ensure compliance with emission control laws to continue selling regulated products in the state. The state board adjusts maximum penalties for inflation based on the California Consumer Price Index, exempt from the Administrative Procedure Act. Penalties collected are deposited in the Air Pollution Control Fund. Section 43151 prohibits the sale, import, or use of uncertified motor vehicles or engines in California. The article exempts certain vehicles from regulations if acquired to replace a damaged or stolen vehicle, transferred by inheritance or court decree, or sold before a specific date. This chapter does not apply to motor vehicles with a federal Clean Air Act certificate of conformity originally registered in another state by a resident who moves to this state and provides proof of previous registration. This exemption will be effective 180 days after regulations are adopted for certifying new direct import vehicles. Section 43154 of the Health and Safety Code is amended to impose civil penalties for violations of emission control laws. The penalty for manufacturers or distributors can be up to $37,500 per violation, with additional requirements for compliance. Dealers may face penalties of up to $10,000 per violation. The state board will adjust the maximum penalty for inflation based on the California Consumer Price Index, exempt from the Administrative Procedure Act. Any action to recover a penalty under this section shall be brought in the name of the people of the State of California in the superior court of the county where the violation occurred, by the Attorney General or other designated officials, with penalties deposited in specific funds. Section 43211 of the Health and Safety Code is amended. Section 43211 of the Health and Safety Code is amended to require new motor vehicles sold in California to meet emission standards set by the state board. Manufacturers failing to meet these standards may face civil penalties up to $37,500 per vehicle. Additionally, penalties for not meeting zero-emission vehicle credit requirements are capped at $5,000 per credit. The state board will adjust maximum penalties for inflation based on the California Consumer Price Index, exempt from the Administrative Procedure Act. Any penalties collected will go into the General Fund. Section 43212 of the Health and Safety Code is amended. Section 43212 of the Health and Safety Code is amended to impose a civil penalty of up to $37,500 for each vehicle that does not comply with emission standards or test procedures in California. Non-compliant manufacturers or distributors may be required to pay penalties and make vehicles compliant before further sales in the state. The state board can adjust the maximum penalty for inflation based on the California Consumer Price Index without following the Administrative Procedure Act. Any penalty collected will go into the Air Pollution Control Fund. The state board has the authority to order a manufacturer of motor vehicles to ensure their vehicles comply with emissions standards they were certified for, with compliance being a condition for continued sales in the state.
